titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hermann Hagedorn Papers
titlestmt.author: by Michael L. Forstrom

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 05:10

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection contains correspondence, writings, clippings, and other materials documenting the life of author Hermann Hagedorn. Correspondence in the collection consists of letters to and from family, friends, other writers, publishers, scholars, and well-known political and cultural figures from the first half of the twentieth century. Noteworthy correspondents include Stephen Vincent Benét, Albert Einstein, Robert Frost, Percy MacKaye, Ezra Pound, Edwin Arlington Robinson, and Albert Schweitzer, as well as Theodore ("Teddy"), Franklin D., and Eleanor Roosevelt. Writings include drafts and research materials for articles, plays, poems, short stories, speeches, and biographical works. In addition, there are clippings on Hagedorn and reviews of his literary and biographical works. Other materials include medals, music, photographs, printed materials, and a scrapbook

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Alta California Bookstore, 1966, with additional small gifts and purchases to 1978.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Hermann Hagedorn Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Hermann Hagedorn Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Preliminary processing was done to the Hermann Hagedorn papers at an unknown date. During reprocessing of the collection in 2010, materials that had been classified separately in Za Robinson (Edwin Arlington Robinson's letters to Hagedorn) and the Za Name File were repatriated; arrangement of correspondence and writings was largely preserved in Series I and II; and clippings and other materials were established as Series III and IV respectively. Folder headings listed below are transcribed from folders.
Formerly classed as Za Hagedorn, Za Robinson, and Za Name File.

bioghist.head: Hermann Hagedorn (1882-1964)
bioghist.p: Hermann Hagedorn was born in New York City in 1882 and educated at Harvard University, the University of Berlin, and Columbia University. From 1909 to 1911 he was an instructor in English at Harvard. Hagedorn was a friend and biographer of Theodore Roosevelt and served as Secretary and Director of the Theodore Roosevelt Association from 1919 to 1957. Hagedorn died in Santa Barbara, California in 1964.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Hermann Hagedorn papers contain correspondence, writings, clippings, and other materials documenting the life of poet and biographer Hermann Hagedorn. Correspondence in the collection consists of letters to and from family, friends, other writers, publishers, scholars, and well-known political and cultural figures from the first half of the twentieth century. Noteworthy correspondents include Stephen Vincent Benét, Albert Einstein, Robert Frost, Percy MacKaye, Ezra Pound, Edwin Arlington Robinson, and Albert Schweitzer, as well as Theodore ("Teddy"), Franklin D., and Eleanor Roosevelt. Writings include drafts and research materials for articles, plays, poems, short stories, speeches, and biographical works. In addition, there are clippings on Hagedorn and reviews of his literary and biographical works. Other materials include medals, music, photographs, printed materials, and a scrapbook.
The collection features material documenting Hagedorn's research on Theodore Roosevelt and his work with the Theodore Roosevelt Association.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Correspondence, 1898-1970. II. Writings, 1900-1962. III. Clippings, 1906-1963. IV. Other Materials, 1900-1964.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I, Correspondence, contains correspondence with family, friends, writers, publishers, scholars, and well-known political and cultural figures from the first half of the twentieth century. Noteworthy correspondents include Stephen Vincent Benét, Albert Einstein, Robert Frost, Percy MacKaye, Ezra Pound, and Edwin Arlington Robinson, as well as Theodore ("Teddy"), Franklin D., and Eleanor Roosevelt. Larger files can be found for the subjects of Hagedorn's biographies: Theodore Roosevelt, E. A. Robinson, and Albert Schweitzer. Correspondence concerning Roosevelt and unsorted correspondence is located at the end of the alphabetical sequence.
Folders may contain third-party correspondence and other materials, such as drafts of manuscripts and printed ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains one letter from Einstein, dated 1950, and other correspondence acquired in a small 1968 purchase.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by title (in quotations or italics), genre, or format.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II, Writings, contains drafts and research materials for articles, plays, poems, short stories, speeches, and biographical works. Hagedorn wrote a number of books on Theodore ("Teddy") Roosevelt and served as Secretary and Director of the Theodore Roosevelt Association, and there are four boxes of materials relating to Roosevelt and the Association.

unittitle.title: The Bomb that Fell on America

did.unittitle: "The Boy in Armor: A Play for Boys"
"Fox, George - notes for a biography of"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes draft with comments by E. A. Robinson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes drafts for "A Spirit in Man", "Fighting Fathers and Fighting Sons" and "Letters from Sagamore Hill"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes drafts for "Resurrection of a Personality"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III, Clippings, contains clippings of general interest on Hermann Hagedorn and reviews of his literary and biographical works.
Unsorted clippings are listed at the end of the alphabetical sequence.

did.unittitle: "The Great Maze" and "The Heart of Youth"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV, Other Materials, contains commemorative materials such as medals and printed ephemera, music, photographs, other printed materials, and a scrapbook.
